isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 2000, 4000, 8000 - ELECTRONIC ENGINES, CUMMINS M11E AND N14E - TROUBLESHOOTING - Service Brake and Clutch Switches

entry.para: Disconnect clutch switch conn. (N/L) from cab harness. With clutch pedal released, measure resistance between the pigtail terminals.
Check switch adjust- ment. Go to next step.

To adjust clutch switch - with pedal at rest position, move the switch so the Wobble Arm is deflected. The switch should actuate (to closed position) with an audible click when the clutch pedal moves from disengaged to rest. Is clutch switch adjusted properly?
Replace and adjust clutch switch. Go to Step 1.
Adjust clutch switch. Go to Step 1.
Depress clutch pedal and measure resistance between clutch switch pigtail connector (N/L) terminals.
If switch is not properly adjusted, adjust per Step 2 and retest. If switch was properly adjusted, replace the switch.
Check clutch switch for short to ground. With switch disconnected, measure resistance to ground at each switch terminal.
Clutch switch each pigtail to gnd.
Clutch switch checks good. Perform Testing Clutch Switch Circuits for "Open and Short" Conditionfollowing.
Replace the clutch switch, then adjust per Step 2.

svcsubproc.title: Clutch Switch Circuits for "Open and Short" Condition
svcsubproc.para: Perform Testing Clutch Switch before performing this test.

caution.para: When testing at ECM connector (320), do not use probes or leads other than Cummins test leads, Part No. 3822758. The connector will be damaged. The leads must fit snug without expanding the connector terminal.

table.title: Testing Clutch Switch Circuits for "Open and Short" Condition

entry.para: With clutch switch disconnected, remove ECM connector (320) from the ECM. Refer to Inspecting International Engine Harness ECM Connector (320)and inspect connector. ECM harness connector or ECM pins OK?

Replace harness connector terminals if damaged. If ECM pins are damaged, have Cummins dealer replace ECM. Refer to Accelerator/ ECM Calibration
to recalibrate ECM/ accelerator pedal.
Turn all CELECT cab switches to off or neutral position and set service brake using trailer hand valve. Use test leads and measure resistance to gnd. at connector (320) terminal 4 and 10.
Locate short to gnd. in circuit where resistance at terminal was less than 100K ohms, then repair.
With CELECT cab switches still in off or neutral position and service brake set, use test leads and measure resistance between terminals 4 and 10 and all other terminals in connector (320).
Locate short between circuits where resistance between terminals is 100K ohms or less, then repair.
The clutch switch circuits are free of short circuits Refer to Accelerator/ ECM Calibrationto recalibrate ECM/ accelerator pedal. Perform Testing Clutch Switch Circuits for Continuity.

svcsubproc.title: Testing Clutch Switch Circuits For Continuity
svcsubproc.para: Perform the two preceding tests before performing this test.

caution.para: When testing at ECM connector (320), do not use probes or leads other than Cummins test leads, Part No. 3822758. The connector will be damaged. The leads must fit snug without expanding the connector terminal.

table.title: Testing Clutch Switch Circuits For Continuity

entry.para: At ECM connector (320) use test lead to jumper terminal 4 to ground. At clutch switch connector (N/L) measure resistance of 97AH to ground.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 97AH between connectors (320) and (N/L), then repair. Refer to Accelerator/ ECM Calibrationto recalibrate ECM/ accelerator pedal.
At ECM connector (320) use test lead to jumper terminal 4 to 10. At clutch switch connector (N/L) measure resistance between circuits 97AH and 97-GH.

Locate open or poor connection in circuit 97-GH/ 97-GA or 97-GA/ 97-G between connectors (320) and (N/L), then repair. Refer to Accelerator/ ECM Calibration
to recalibrate ECM/ accelerator pedal.
The clutch switch circuits and switch check good. Refer to Accelerator/ ECM Calibrationto recalibrate ECM/ accelerator pedal.
Remove conn. (69) from brake switch. With brakes released, measure resistance across switch terminals. Switch should be closed.
Apply service brakes and measure resistance across the brake pressure switch. Switch should be open. NOTE: Sufficient air pressure must be present to apply service brakes for this test step.
Measure resistance to ground at both brake switch terminals with service brakes applied, and with brakes released. Both should be isolated from ground at all times.
Brake pressure switch both terminals to gnd.

Reconnect (69) to brake switch. Perform Testing Service Brake Switch Circuits for "Open and Short" Condition
following.

svcsubproc.title: Testing Service Brake Switch Circuits For "Open and Short" Condition
svcsubproc.para: Perform Testing Service Brake Switch (69) before performing this test.

caution.para: When testing at ECM connector (320), do not use probes or leads other than Cummins test leads, Part No. 3822758. The connector will be damaged. The leads must fit snug without expanding the connector terminal.

table.title: Testing Service Brake Switch Circuits For "Open and Short" Condition

entry.para:
With conn. (69) disconnected from brake switch, remove connector (320) from the ECM. Refer to Inspecting International Engine Harness ECM Connector (320)
to inspect connector. ECM connector and ECM pins OK?

Replace harness connector terminals if damaged. If ECM pins damaged, have Cummins dealer replace ECM. Refer to Accelerator/ ECM Calibration
to recalibrate ECM/ accelerator pedal.
Turn all CELECT cab switches to off or neutral position and disconnect clutch switch. Use test leads and measure resistance to gnd. at conn. (320) terminals 13 and 10.
Locate short to ground. in circuit where resistance at terminal was 100K ohms or less, then repair.
Use test leads and measure resistance between terminal 13 and 10 and all other terminals in connector (320).
Locate short between any circuit where resistance between terminals is less than 100K ohms, then repair.
The brake switch circuits are free of short circuits. Refer to Accelerator/ ECM Calibrationto recalibrate ECM/ accelerator pedal. Perform Testing Service Brake Switch Circuits for Continuity.

svcsubproc.title: Testing Service Brake Switch Circuits for Continuity
svcsubproc.para: Perform Testing Service Brake Switch Circuits For "Open and Short" Condition before performing this test.

caution.para: When testing at ECM connector (320), do not use probes or leads other than Cummins test leads, Part No. 3822758. The connector will be damaged. The leads must fit snug without expanding the connector terminal.

table.title: Testing Service Brake Switch Circuits for Continuity

entry.para: At ECM connector (320) use test lead to jumper terminal 13 to gnd. At brake switch connector (69) measure resistance to gnd. at circuit 97AL.

Locate open or poor connection in circuit 97AL between connectors (320) and (69), then repair. Refer to Accelerator/ ECM Calibration
to recalibrate ECM/ accelerator pedal.
At ECM connector (320) use test lead to jumper terminal 13 to terminal 10. At brake switch connector (69) measure resistance between circuits 97AL and 97H.

Locate open or poor connection in circuit 97H, 97-GF/ 97-GA, or 97-GA/ 97-G between connectors (320) and (69), then repair. Refer to Accelerator/ ECM Calibration
to recalibrate ECM/ accelerator pedal.

The service brake switch circuits and switch check good. Refer to Accelerator/ ECM Calibration
to recalibrate ECM/ accelerator pedal.
